verses.text: And this \add is\add* the thing that thou shalt do unto them to hallow them, to minister unto me in the priest’s office: Take one young bullock, and two rams without blemish,
and unleavened bread, and cakes unleavened tempered with oil, and wafers unleavened anointed with oil: \add of\add* wheaten flour shalt thou make them.
And thou shalt put them into one basket, and bring them in the basket, with the bullock and the two rams.
And Aaron and his sons thou shalt bring unto the door of the tabernacle of the congregation, and shalt wash them with water.
And thou shalt take the garments, and put upon Aaron the coat, and the robe of the ephod, and the ephod, and the breastplate, and gird him with the curious girdle of the ephod:
and thou shalt put the mitre upon his head, and put the holy crown upon the mitre.
Then shalt thou take the anointing oil, and pour \add it\add* upon his head, and anoint him.
And thou shalt bring his sons, and put coats upon them.

And thou shalt gird them \add with\add* girdles, Aaron and his sons, and put the bonnets on them: and the priest’s office shall be theirs for a perpetual statute: and thou shalt consecrate Aaron and his sons.
And thou shalt cause a bullock to be brought before the tabernacle of the congregation: and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the bullock.
And thou shalt kill the bullock before the \sc Lord\sc*, \add by\add* the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.
And thou shalt take of the blood of the bullock, and put \add it\add* upon the horns of the altar with thy finger, and pour all the blood beside the bottom of the altar.

And thou shalt take all the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul \add that is\add* above the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that \add is\add* upon them, and burn \add them\add* upon the altar.
But the flesh of the bullock, and his skin, and his dung, shalt thou burn with fire without the camp: it \add is\add* a sin offering.
Thou shalt also take one ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.
And thou shalt slay the ram, and thou shalt take his blood, and sprinkle \add it\add* round about upon the altar.
And thou shalt cut the ram in pieces, and wash the inwards of him, and his legs, and put \add them\add* unto his pieces, and unto his head.
And thou shalt burn the whole ram upon the altar: it \add is\add* a burnt offering unto the \sc Lord\sc*: it \add is\add* a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And thou shalt take the other ram; and Aaron and his sons shall put their hands upon the head of the ram.

Then shalt thou kill the ram, and take of his blood, and put \add it\add* upon the tip of the \add right\add* ear of Aaron, and upon the tip of the right ear of his sons, and upon the thumb of their right hand, and upon the great toe of their right foot, and sprinkle the blood upon the altar round about.

And thou shalt take of the blood that \add is\add* upon the altar, and of the anointing oil, and sprinkle \add it\add* upon Aaron, and upon his garments, and upon his sons, and upon the garments of his sons with him: and he shall be hallowed, and his garments, and his sons, and his sons’ garments with him.

Also thou shalt take of the ram the fat and the rump, and the fat that covereth the inwards, and the caul \add above\add* the liver, and the two kidneys, and the fat that \add is\add* upon them, and the right shoulder; for it \add is\add* a ram of consecration:
and one loaf of bread, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer out of the basket of the unleavened bread that \add is\add* before the \sc Lord\sc*:
and thou shalt put all in the hands of Aaron, and in the hands of his sons; and shalt wave them \add for\add* a wave offering before the \sc Lord\sc*.

And thou shalt receive them of their hands, and burn \add them\add* upon the altar for a burnt offering, for a sweet savour before the \sc Lord\sc*: it \add is\add* an offering made by fire unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And thou shalt take the breast of the ram of Aaron’s consecrations, and wave it \add for\add* a wave offering before the \sc Lord\sc*: and it shall be thy part.

And thou shalt sanctify the breast of the wave offering, and the shoulder of the heave offering, which is waved, and which is heaved up, of the ram of the consecration, \add even\add* of \add that\add* which \add is\add* for Aaron, and of \add that\add* which \add is\add* for his sons:

and it shall be Aaron’s and his sons’ by a statute for ever from the children of Israel: for it \add is\add* a heave offering: and it shall be a heave offering from the children of Israel of the sacrifice of their peace offerings, \add even\add* their heave offering unto the \sc Lord\sc*.
And the holy garments of Aaron shall be his sons’ after him, to be anointed therein, and to be consecrated in them.
\add And\add* that son that is priest in his stead shall put them on seven days, when he cometh into the tabernacle of the congregation to minister in the holy \add place\add*.
And thou shalt take the ram of the consecration, and seethe his flesh in the holy place.
And Aaron and his sons shall eat the flesh of the ram, and the bread that \add is\add* in the basket, \add by\add* the door of the tabernacle of the congregation.

And they shall eat those \add things\add* wherewith the atonement was made, to consecrate \add and\add* to sanctify them: but a stranger shall not eat \add thereof\add*, because they \add are\add* holy.
And if \add ought\add* of the flesh of the consecrations, or of the bread, remain unto the morning, then thou shalt burn the remainder with fire: it shall not be eaten, because it \add is\add* holy.
And thus shalt thou do unto Aaron, and to his sons, according to all \add things\add* which I have commanded thee: seven days shalt thou consecrate them.

And thou shalt offer every day a bullock \add for\add* a sin offering for atonement: and thou shalt cleanse the altar, when thou hast made an atonement for it, and thou shalt anoint it, to sanctify it.
Seven days thou shalt make an atonement for the altar, and sanctify it; and it shall be an altar most holy: whatsoever toucheth the altar shall be holy.
Now this \add is that\add* which thou shalt offer upon the altar; two lambs of the first year day by day continually.
The one lamb thou shalt offer in the morning; and the other lamb thou shalt offer at even:
and with the one lamb a tenth deal of flour mingled with the fourth part of a hin of beaten oil; and the fourth \add part\add* of a hin of wine \add for\add* a drink offering.

And the other lamb thou shalt offer at even, \add and\add* shalt do thereto according to the meat offering of the morning, and according to the drink offering thereof, for a sweet savour, an offering made by fire unto the \sc Lord\sc*.

\add This shall be\add* a continual burnt offering throughout your generations \add at\add* the door of the tabernacle of the congregation before the \sc Lord\sc*: where I will meet you, to speak there unto thee.
And there I will meet with the children of Israel, and \add the tabernacle\add* shall be sanctified by my glory.
And I will sanctify the tabernacle of the congregation, and the altar: I will sanctify also both Aaron and his sons, to minister to me in the priest’s office.
And I will dwell amongst the children of Israel, and will be their God.
And they shall know that I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* their God, that brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, that I may dwell amongst them: I \add am\add* the \sc Lord\sc* their God.
